Twitter Swiss Army Knife

Dump User TimeLine

Commands | Dump User TimeLine

Table of Contents

  • Dump User TimeLine
    • Dump by Twitter Screen Name
    • Dump by Twitter ID


Dump by Twitter Screen Name:

LONG FORMAT

Reads Twitter credentials directly from command line arguments.

java -jar TSAK.jar tsak -consumerKey=XXXX -consumerSecret=XXXX -accessToken=XXXX -accessSecret=XXXX dumpFollowerIDs -uname ScreenName -o output.txt

SHORT FORMAT

Reads Twitter credentials from tsak.properties file as pointed by TSAK_CONF ENV variable.

java -jar TSAK.jar tsak dumpFollowerIDs -uname ScreenName -o output.txt

Arguments:

XXXX:

Twitter APP and User Keys. Please refer to SETUP page to see how to generate these four keys.

-uname:

Target User Twitter ScreenName.

-o:

Name of the output file to which the target user's Statuses will be dumped.

Description:

Based on provided Credentials, this command dumps a twitter user's Statuses to a file. The number of dumped Tweets are subjected to Twitter rate limits and cannot exceeds 2700/15min.




Dump by Twitter ID:

LONG FORMAT

Reads Twitter credentials directly from command line arguments.

java -jar TSAK.jar tsak -consumerKey=XXXX -consumerSecret=XXXX -accessToken=XXXX -accessSecret=XXXX dumpFollowerIDs -uid 101010111 -o output.txt

SHORT FORMAT

Reads Twitter credentials from tsak.properties file as pointed by TSAK_CONF ENV variable.

java -jar TSAK.jar tsak dumpFollowerIDs -uid 101010111 -o output.txt

XXXX:

Twitter APP and User Keys. Please refer to SETUP page to see how to generate these four keys.

-uid:

Target User's Twitter ID.

-o:

Name of the output file to which the target user's Statuses will be dumped.

Description:

Based on provided Credentials, this command dumps a twitter user's Statuses to a file. The number of dumped Tweets are subjected to Twitter rate limits and cannot exceeds 2700/15min.
